newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Persetel joins up with black partner.
newsitem.headline: Persetel joins up with black partner.

text.p: South African information technology firm Persetel Holdings' unit Persetel Networks said on Wednesday it had formed a partnership with black empowerment group Consolidated Empowerment Initiative (CEIN) in a bid to reposition itself as a full networks systems integrator.
Persetel Networks said it would also acquire a stake in CEIN, recently established by several black operational players in the IT industry.

"The partnership between Persetel Networks and CEIN will maximise the benefits of the synergies between the two organisations including complementary product sets, technical skills and significant marketing opportunities," Persetel Networks said in a statement.
It said CEIN had been appointed a Cisco Systems integrator in December 1996.
The firm added that its move was a further step towards the development of Persetel Holdings' black empowerment strategy and would give it access to the full CISCO product range.

"Offering a broader product range will allow us to transcend the product battle...(and) will allow us to meet our clients' business requirements and act as a true networks systems integrator," Persetel Networks managing director Gerrit Basson said.
Persetel Networks is currently a Bay Networks Reseller, and represents Ascend, Cascade, Apertus, Cray, Intel, Motorola and Nanoteq in South Africa.
